title.narrative: 3.4 NUTRITION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Output 3.4: Children and women in humanitarian situations have timely and sustained access to quality preventive and rehabilitative nutrition services and support, which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition (Covid), Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 3: Children, adolescent mothers and women, particularly in vulnerable and deprived areas, have increased access to quality services and information, and adopt appropriate nutritional practices to prevent and treat malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.4: Children and women in humanitarian situations have timely and sustained access to quality preventive andrehabilitative nutrition services and support

description.narrative: Across six states with the humanitarian crisis in the northeast and northwest, UNICEF supported the government and partners to scale up the Family MUAC approach at the community level as a preventive and monitoring strategy in the context of COVID-19 and rising insecurity. The pipeline for life-saving commodities was secure for the northeast and the northwest as per the HAC target. Overall, UNICEF and partners, including the government, achieved a 96 percent cure rate exceeding the 75 percent threshold defined by Sphere in a humanitarian context.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2021
